page.title: 04ENTERTAINMENT AT HOME
page.content: We looked at the hobbies and pastimes that take place in children's homes, and discovered an enormous variety of things taking place. Many children collected things, vary- ing from cards and pictures to stick in albums, to stamps, toy dolls, fluffy animal toys, models from films like the 'Star Wars' series, postage stamps, comics, records or tapes and rubbers. The latest crazes are collecting My Little Pony dolls for girls, and the boys like toy robots that change into cars, lorries and dinosaurs. Other pastimes involved the parents and include piano playing, sewing, drawing and painting, ballet and tap dancing, chess, snooker, horse riding and DIY. Of course, TV and radio and listening to music still provide enter- tainment as does reading books, etc.
